domain.name: Marketing
domain.description: The Marketing domain encompasses all processes related to promoting, selling, and distributing a product or service. It involves understanding customer needs, creating value, and communicating effectively to drive business growth.

processes.name: Market Research
processes.description: The process of gathering, analyzing, and interpreting information about a market, including information about the target market, customers, and competitors.

subprocesses.name: Customer Analysis
subprocesses.description: Identifying and understanding customer needs, preferences, and behaviors.

subprocesses.name: Surveys and Questionnaires
subprocesses.description: Designing and conducting surveys to gather customer feedback.

subprocesses.name: Focus Groups
subprocesses.description: Organizing focus group sessions to gather qualitative insights.

subprocesses.name: Competitor Analysis
subprocesses.description: Assessing competitors to identify their strengths and weaknesses.

subprocesses.name: SWOT Analysis
subprocesses.description: Conducting SWOT analysis to evaluate competitor position.

subprocesses.name: Market Positioning
subprocesses.description: Determining how competitors are positioned in the market.

subprocesses.name: Market Trend Analysis
subprocesses.description: Identifying and analyzing current and future market trends.

subprocesses.name: Trend Monitoring
subprocesses.description: Tracking market trends over time.

subprocesses.name: Data Interpretation
subprocesses.description: Interpreting data to forecast future trends.

processes.name: Marketing Strategy Development
processes.description: Developing strategies to effectively market a product or service to achieve organizational goals.

subprocesses.name: Target Market Segmentation
subprocesses.description: Dividing a market into distinct groups of buyers with different needs or behaviors.

subprocesses.name: Demographic Segmentation
subprocesses.description: Segmenting the market based on demographic factors.

subprocesses.name: Psychographic Segmentation
subprocesses.description: Segmenting the market based on lifestyle and personality traits.

subprocesses.name: Value Proposition Design
subprocesses.description: Creating a compelling value proposition that addresses the needs of the target market.

subprocesses.name: Unique Selling Proposition (USP) Development
subprocesses.description: Identifying what makes the product or service unique.

subprocesses.name: Benefit Analysis
subprocesses.description: Analyzing the benefits provided to the customers.

subprocesses.name: Marketing Mix Planning
subprocesses.description: Determining the right mix of product, price, place, and promotion strategies.

subprocesses.name: Product Strategy
subprocesses.description: Defining product features and benefits.

subprocesses.name: Pricing Strategy
subprocesses.description: Establishing pricing models and strategies.

processes.name: Marketing Campaign Management
processes.description: Planning, executing, and monitoring marketing campaigns to promote products or services.

subprocesses.name: Campaign Planning
subprocesses.description: Developing a campaign plan that outlines objectives, target audience, and tactics.

subprocesses.name: Objective Setting
subprocesses.description: Defining clear and measurable campaign objectives.

subprocesses.name: Budget Allocation
subprocesses.description: Allocating financial resources for the campaign.

subprocesses.name: Campaign Execution
subprocesses.description: Implementing the campaign plan using various marketing channels.

subprocesses.name: Content Creation
subprocesses.description: Developing marketing materials and content.

subprocesses.name: Channel Deployment
subprocesses.description: Selecting and utilizing appropriate marketing channels.

subprocesses.name: Campaign Monitoring and Evaluation
subprocesses.description: Tracking performance and assessing the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.

subprocesses.name: Performance Metrics
subprocesses.description: Identifying and tracking key performance indicators (KPIs).

subprocesses.name: Post-Campaign Review
subprocesses.description: Analyzing campaign results and identifying areas for improvement.

dependencies.description: Customer insights from analysis inform the segmentation strategies.
Competitor analysis helps in designing a compelling value proposition.
Target market segmentation guides the planning of marketing campaigns.
The value proposition influences the content and approach of campaign execution.
Campaign performance data is used to analyze and adapt to market trends.
